channel.title: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D
channel.description:
How to run a server on a mac :D ! This is my first tutorial, it will show you how to run a client and a server on your mac :D
So firstly, we need to download some stuff: SoyLatte - [url=https://adsdevshop-public.s3.amazonaws.com/soylatte16-i386-1.0.3.tar.bz2]CLICK HERE (32-bit)[/url] , [url=https://adsdevshop-public.s3.amazonaws.com/soylatte16-amd64-1.0.3.tar.bz2]CLICK HERE (64-bit)[/url] MacPorts - [url=http://distfiles.macports.org/MacPorts/MacPorts-1.9.2-10.5-Leopard.dmg]CLICK HERE (32-bit)[/url] , [url=http://distfiles.macports.org/MacPorts/MacPorts-1.9.2-10.6-SnowLeopard.dmg]CLICK HERE (64-bit)[/url] and any server and client
========== Contents ========== 1) Installing & configuring MacPorts 2) Setting $PATH 3) Using Clients AND Servers. ============================
1) Installing MacPorts.
Go to The directory of where the MacPorts.PKG is: [img]http://img16.imageshack.us/img16/3323/picture1xzd.png[/img]
Open the Package, and follow all the instructions of the installer.
Next, Open up the terminal, you can search for it using the search button in the top right corner:
[img]http://img27.imageshack.us/img27/841/picture2cs.png[/img]
now that we're in the the terminal type: [code]sudo port -v selfupdate[/code]
It will ask you for your password
Then, you should get an output that looks like this:
[code]---> Updating the ports tree Synchronizing local ports tree from rsync://rsync.macports.org/release/ports/ receiving file list ... done ./ print/cups-pdf/ print/cups-pdf/Portfile
sent 115 bytes received 507728 bytes 40627.44 bytes/sec total size is 27982214 speedup is 55.10 Creating port index in /opt/local/var/macports/sources/rsync.macports.org/release/ports Adding port print/cups-pdf
Total number of ports parsed: 1 Ports successfully parsed: 1 Ports failed: 0 Up-to-date ports skipped: 7789
---> Updating MacPorts base sources using rsync receiving file list ... done
sent 32 bytes received 6854 bytes 2754.40 bytes/sec total size is 2889184 speedup is 419.57 MacPorts base version 1.9.2 installed, MacPorts base version 1.9.2 downloaded. ---> MacPorts base is already the latest version
The ports tree has been updated. To upgrade your installed ports, you should run port upgrade outdated[/code]
You Have successfully Downloaded and installed Ports :D
2) Setting Path
Okay, now that we have installed Ports we are now able to set-up the path.
Firstly, Go to the directory of the Soylatte .Tar.bz2 archive. Then double click it. something similar to this should show up
[img]http://img839.imageshack.us/img839/592/picture4pa.png[/img]
Optionally, you can rename the folder we just extracted to : soylatte16-1.0.3
Thirdly, we are going to move that folder to the folder Named "system" [img]http://img9.imageshack.us/img9/7779/picture5qh.png[/img] It will ask for you to authenticate, Click the authenticate button and type in your password. lastly, We are going to setup $Path By going into terminal and typing:
[code]open /Applications/TextEdit.app .profile[/code]
Something similar to this should open up:
[img]http://img130.imageshack.us/img130/355/picture6lc.png[/img]
now we are going to replace the first path with this:
[code]export PATH=/System/soylatte16-1.0.3/bin:$PATH[/code]
it should now look like this:
[img]http://img834.imageshack.us/img834/9550/picture7gy.png[/img]
Save the file. Well done, You have successfully Installed JDK and set the $PATH
3)Using Clients and servers:
to compile a server use this code:
[code]cd /path/to/file javac *.java[/code]
to run a server use this code:
[code]cd /path/to/file java -Xmx1024m -cp .:.jython.jar:./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server[/code]
To run a client:
[code] cd /path/to/file JAVA -Xmx500m client[/code]
remember to replace /Path/To/File/ to where the files are.
and That's all you have to do! thanks for taking time to read and follow through this Tutorial if you have any problems or anything i should change just leave a comment :)

item.title: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

No offense…but why would you want to host a server on a mac…

[me=hadesflames]points at centOS[/me]

Read full topic
item.source: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D

item.title: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D
item.dc:creator: @LatestLeech LatestLeech
item.description:
@LatestLeech wrote:

when trying to install mac ports i get this error when it checks if i can install

Xcode is not installed, or was installed with UNIX Development (10.5+) or Command Line Support (10.4) deselected.

Read full topic
item.source: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D

item.title: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Why would you install SoyLatte when the Mac comes with Apple’s JVM pre-installed? If you need to run a Java 6 server on OS X Leopard this would make sense, but if your on an Intel Mac, which SoyLatte requires, just upgrade to Snow Leopard and you’ll have Apple’s Java 6. :eek:

Read full topic
item.source: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D

item.title: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

It’s moparscape, I need not say more.

Read full topic

@Wintercanon wrote:

If you use a Mac, you should already know how to execute a basic Java program from the console…

item.title: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

It’s fairly basic, although this may help a lot of people who prefer to use Mac.

Good job.

P.S Linux is better

Read full topic

item.title: Running a Server and client. ON MAC :D
item.dc:creator: @D-Ylan D-Ylan
item.description:
@D-Ylan wrote:

How to run a server on a mac !
This is my first tutorial, it will show you how to run a client and a server on your mac

So firstly, we need to download some stuff:
SoyLatte - CLICK HERE (32-bit) , CLICK HERE (64-bit)
MacPorts - CLICK HERE (32-bit) , CLICK HERE (64-bit)
and any server and client

========== Contents ==========

  1. Installing & configuring MacPorts

  2. Setting $PATH

  3. Using Clients AND Servers.
    ============================

  4. Installing MacPorts.

Go to The directory of where the MacPorts.PKG is:

Open the Package, and follow all the instructions of the installer.

Next, Open up the terminal, you can search for it using the search button in the top right corner:

now that we’re in the the terminal type:

sudo port -v selfupdate

It will ask you for your password

Then, you should get an output that looks like this:

[code]—> Updating the ports tree
Synchronizing local ports tree from rsync://rsync.macports.org/release/ports/
receiving file list … done
./
print/cups-pdf/
print/cups-pdf/Portfile

sent 115 bytes received 507728 bytes 40627.44 bytes/sec
total size is 27982214 speedup is 55.10
Creating port index in /opt/local/var/macports/sources/rsync.macports.org/release/ports
Adding port print/cups-pdf

Total number of ports parsed: 1
Ports successfully parsed: 1
Ports failed: 0
Up-to-date ports skipped: 7789

—> Updating MacPorts base sources using rsync
receiving file list … done

sent 32 bytes received 6854 bytes 2754.40 bytes/sec
total size is 2889184 speedup is 419.57
MacPorts base version 1.9.2 installed,
MacPorts base version 1.9.2 downloaded.
—> MacPorts base is already the latest version

The ports tree has been updated. To upgrade your installed ports, you should run
port upgrade outdated[/code]

You Have successfully Downloaded and installed Ports

  1. Setting Path

Okay, now that we have installed Ports we are now able to set-up the path.

Firstly, Go to the directory of the Soylatte .Tar.bz2 archive. Then double click it.
something similar to this should show up

Optionally, you can rename the folder we just extracted to : soylatte16-1.0.3

Thirdly, we are going to move that folder to the folder Named “system”

It will ask for you to authenticate, Click the authenticate button and type in your password.
lastly, We are going to setup $Path By going into terminal and typing:

open /Applications/TextEdit.app .profile

Something similar to this should open up:

now we are going to replace the first path with this:

export PATH=/System/soylatte16-1.0.3/bin:$PATH

it should now look like this:

Save the file. Well done, You have successfully Installed JDK and set the $PATH

3)Using Clients and servers:

to compile a server use this code:

cd /path/to/file javac *.java

to run a server use this code:

cd /path/to/file java -Xmx1024m -cp .:.jython.jar:./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

To run a client:

cd /path/to/file JAVA -Xmx500m client

remember to replace /Path/To/File/ to where the files are.

and That’s all you have to do!
thanks for taking time to read and follow through this Tutorial
if you have any problems or anything i should change just leave a comment
